results.title: The Big country (S)
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Gregory Peck, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Big country is a western epic that has it all: a classic story, an all-star cast and the impeccable direction of Academy Award winning veteran, William Wyler. Gregory Peck stars as a sea captain who trades the expanse of the oceans for the open range of the West and grows to regret his choice. Charlton Heston is the menacing ranch foreman who loves the land and has a keen eye on McKay’s fiancee (Carroll Baker). The superlative cast is rounded out by Burl Ives in an Oscar winning role, Jean Simmons, Charles Bickford and Chuck Connors.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Biosphere
results.creator_credit: William Pettigrew, Colin Low, Peter Katadotis, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The McKenzie and Amazon Valleys are 10,000 kilometres distant from one another and are certainly distinct ecologically. Yet in a subtle sense they are collaborating elements within the biosphere - the Earth’s thin layer of living matter. This film examines two of the myriad river ecosystems and shows how they are linked within the biosphere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Pettigrew, Colin Low, Peter Katadotis, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Bigamist
results.creator_credit: Ida Lupino, Collier Young, Republic Pictures Corporation and Filmmakers
results.brief_description: A childless couple, Harry (Edmund O’Brien) and Eve Graham (Joan Fontaine) apply to adopt a child in their home city of San Francisco. The meticulous adoption agent, Mr Jordan (Edmund Gwenn) suspects something is awry and investigates every corner of Harry’s life before approving the adoption. He soon discovers that Harry has another life and another wife (Ida Lupino) in Los Angeles. Before Jordan reports Harry to the police he listens to his story. Ida Lupino was one of the few women directors working regularly in Hollywood during the 50’s, 60’s and 70’s. She also produced and wrote for both film and television during this period. Her acting career spanned fifty years from the 1930s to the 1980s.

results.title: The Big trail (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Big Trail covers the journey of hundreds of settlers in covered wagons from the Mississippi River to their destiny out west. John Wayne as Breck Coleman leads them through the rugged terrain and falls in love on the way.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raoul Walsh and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Life in the Kimberleys
results.creator_credit: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rhys Bedford has a lot of doors open to him, now that he is the recipient of a scholarship at Hale College in Western Australia. But it is when he returns to his family in Kununurra that Bedford gets to explore and reconnect with his country and heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Big snit
results.creator_credit: Richard Condie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This wonderfully wacky animated film looks at two simultaneous conflicts, the macrocosm of global nuclear war and the microcosm of a domestic quarrel, and how each conflict is resolved. Presented with warmth and unexpectedly off-the-wall humour, the film is open to a multitude of interpretations. (Awards: Montreal, Toronto, Chicago, San Francisco, Annecy, Hiroshima, Cracow, Zagreb, Tampere)

results.title: Young and proud
results.creator_credit: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A young, successful and proud Yamatji woman, Leah Latham attributes the person she is today to growing up with different cultures. She acknowledges it can be hard being a mix of English and Indigenous cultures, but believes it has also made her the person she is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Big Sleep
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Raymond Chandler’s novel of the same name, “The Big Sleep” stars Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe, the private eye who “dares to walk the mean streets alone”. Investigating a series of gambling debts he comes across plenty of murder, blackmail, kidnapping and violence. Lauren Bacall plays opposite Bogart and the screen magic between them in this film is legendary. The witty dialogue is scripted by William Faulkner. A consummate Hollywood film noir.
